title: Microsoft Shuts Down Windows 10 Insider Beta Channel Again
text:
Microsoft Shuts Down Windows 10 Insider Beta Channel Again
UPDATE: Microsoft has officially closed the Beta channel of Windows 10 Insiders program. The last Windows 10 build released to Beta channel was 19045.5194 (KB5046714). The existing beta channel testers will be automatically moved to the Release Preview channel.
Here is a great news for Windows 10 users who want to stick with their OS and don’t want to upgrade to Windows 11. Microsoft has re-added the good old “Beta Channel” to Windows 10 Insiders program which will allow interested Windows 10 users to early test drive new features and changes which will become a part of Windows 10 in future.
Addition of the Beta channel to Windows Insiders program proves that Microsoft hasn’t forgotten Windows 10 and the company has plans to add new features to Windows 10 in coming months and years which also indicates that Windows 10 might get the support time extended in future.
Existing Windows 10 users who don’t want to receive new Windows 11 features, might not like this news. Many people consider the Windows 11 ported features as bloatware which might slow down Windows 10 devices.
Anyway, Microsoft made an official announcement about it yesterday at Windows Insiders blog. In this article, we’ll discuss all the important points in details and easy language.
Table of Contents
[Windows 10 Gets the Beta Channel Back on Windows Insiders Program](#windows_10_gets_the_beta_channel_back_on_windows_insiders_program)[Microsoft Wants to Port Windows 11 Features and Changes to Windows 10](#microsoft_wants_to_port_windows_11_features_and_changes_to_windows_10)[What New Features can be Expected to Arrive in Windows 10 in Future?](#what_new_features_can_be_expected_to_arrive_in_windows_10_in_future)[Important Things to Know About New Beta Channel of Windows 10 Insiders Program](#important_things_to_know_about_new_beta_channel_of_windows_10_insiders_program)[Windows 10 Insiders Program also Displays Dev and Canary Channels But!](#windows_10_insiders_program_also_displays_dev_and_canary_channels_but)[How to Join Beta Channel of Windows 10 Insiders Program?](#how_to_join_beta_channel_of_windows_10_insiders_program)
Windows 10 Gets the Beta Channel Back on Windows Insiders Program
When Windows 11 didn’t exist and Windows 10 was the latest Windows version, Microsoft was using the Windows Insiders program to early test the new features and changes in the OS before making them available to general public.
Windows Insiders program is a testing program which can be joined for free to help Microsoft in testing early builds of Windows operating system and provide feedback and suggestions to Microsoft. This program helps Microsoft in fixing bugs and issues and improving the OS.
In past, Windows 10 Insiders program had 3 channels or rings to choose from while joining the Insiders program:
- Dev channel or Fast & Skip Ahead ring
- Beta channel or Slow ring
- Release Preview channel or ring
Understanding New Windows 10 Insiders Channels: Dev, Beta and Release Preview
Understanding Windows 10 Insider Preview Branches, Rings and Release Channels
When Windows 11 was released, Microsoft decided to stop working on Windows 10 OS and removed Dev (fast & skip ahead) and Beta (slow) channels from the Windows 10 Insiders program. After that, Windows 10 Insiders program had only one channel or ring to select i.e. Release Preview channel.
Microsoft was regularly releasing small updates for the latest Windows 10 22H2 version on the Release Preview channel. We have a dedicated article to inform the readers about new Windows 10 Insider Preview builds at following link:
New Windows 10 22H2 Insider Preview Build Released to Preview Channel
Now Microsoft has announced that the company has restored the previous Beta channel to Windows 10 Insiders program. Here is a small part of the official announcement:
At the end of last year, we announced a change in approach for Windows 10 to make sure everyone can get the maximum value from their current Windows PC. To bring new features and more improvements to Windows 10 as needed, we need a place to do active feature development with Windows Insiders. So today, we are opening the Beta Channel for Windows Insiders who are currently on Windows 10. This will allow us to try out new features for Windows 10, version 22H2, with Insiders before releasing them to all Windows 10 customers.
Microsoft Wants to Port Windows 11 Features and Changes to Windows 10
The re-addition of Beta channel to Windows 10 Insiders program makes one thing very clear to all i.e. Microsoft has plans to add new functionality to Windows 10 specially the new features and changes available in Windows 11.
Recently Microsoft added or ported Copilot feature to Windows 10. In past, Microsoft specifically announced that the company will not add any new feature to Windows 10 and no feature update will be released to Windows 10 but Microsoft changed this decision and started adding new features to Windows 10 again.
Here are a few Windows 11 exclusive features which were recently ported to Windows 10:
Copilot AI feature- The “
Get the latest updates as soon as they’re available” toggle feature on Windows Updates page Weather forecast information on Windows 10 Lock ScreenMicrosoft Account notifications on Start Menu and Settings homepageWindows Spotlight Feature on DesktopNew search box experiencepowered by Bing on Taskbar
Now the launch of Beta channel indicates that the company wants to add more big features to Windows 10 which will require thorough testing before making them available to the public.
What New Features can be Expected to Arrive in Windows 10 in Future?
Microsoft has already ported Copilot program and other few features to Windows 10. Following are a few other important or Windows 11 exclusive features which might come to Windows 10 in our opinion:
- New windowed mode in Copilot where it acts like a normal application window which can be resized and moved around the screen.
- Native support for reading additional archive file formats such as .tar, .rar, .7z, etc using the libarchive open-source project.
- New File Explorer powered by WinUI 3
- Modernized Details Pane in File Explorer (
More info) - Revamped Widgets Board experience
- Revamped Settings app experience
- Redesigned
Task Managerexperience Microsoft AccountandInternet connection requirementsat Windows 10 installation similar to Windows 11- Windows 11 UI features such as
context menus,Start MenuandTaskbar
Above mentioned features might come to Windows 10 as they were added to Windows 11 Insider Preview builds in past. If you want to take a look at all testing features which have been added to Windows 11 Insider Preview builds and might be added to Windows 10 in coming months, here are the links of our exclusive changelog articles for your reading pleasure:
Windows 11 Dev Insider Preview Builds Changelog
Windows 11 Canary Insider Preview Builds Changelog
Important Things to Know About New Beta Channel of Windows 10 Insiders Program
If you are excited about the new testing channel of Windows 10 and want to join it, here are a few important things to keep in mind:
- Any Windows 10 user can join or switch to Windows Insiders program for free using the existing license key.
- Even if your device meets the
system requirements for Windows 11, your Windows 10 device will not be automatically upgraded to Windows 11 after switching to Beta channel. Windows 11 upgrade will be shown as optional update on Windows Updates page and the user can decide to upgrade or not. - Windows 10 end of support date is still
October 14, 2025and remains unchanged. But the addition of Beta channel gives a hope to all Windows 10 users. - All new features and changes introduced on Beta channel might come or not to public depending upon the feedback received from the insiders/testers.
- Interested users can join or switch to Beta channel right now using the steps given below in this article.
Windows 10 Insiders Program also Displays Dev and Canary Channels But!
Windows 10 Insiders program page now shows four channels available to choose from, which are as following:
- Canary channel
- Dev channel
- Beta channel
- Release Preview channel
Don’t get confused about the Canary and Dev channels. These channels are available for Windows 11 Insider Preview builds only. If you select Canary or Dev channel, you’ll be registered to Windows 11 Insider program and your device will be upgraded to Windows 11 Insider Preview build.
PS: Canary and Dev channel will appear only if your device meets Windows 11 minimum system requirements.
So remember only Beta and Release Preview channels are available for Windows 10 Insider Preview builds.
How to Join Beta Channel of Windows 10 Insiders Program?
If you are ready to switch to Beta channel and want to test early testing builds of Windows 10 operating system, you can join the new Beta channel or Release Preview channel using following steps:
STEP 1: Open Settings app from https://www.askvg.com/windows-10-start-menu-review-tips-n-tricks-and-customization/ or by pressing WIN+I keys together.
STEP 2: Now click on Update & Security section present on the homepage.
STEP 3: Now click on Windows Insider Program section present in the left sidebar.
STEP 4: Now you can join the Windows 10 Insiders program. If you are already registered, you can change the channel by selecting any desired option given on the page.
STEP 5: Now go to Windows Update page and click on Check for updates button. Windows 10 will check for new builds and once a new Insider Preview build becomes available, you can click on Download now button to start downloading the new update build of Windows 10.
After downloading the build, your computer will automatically restart to install the new update. The download size will be around 2 or 3 GB depending upon the computer architecture (32-bit or 64-bit) and system language.
